q: in loving memory of Sweet Jasmine, who was one of the rescued dogs from Michael Vick 's property. Jasmine is also featured on the cover of Jim Gorant's " The Lost Dogs ." Jasmine's House and its mission will strive to end the neglect, cruelty, and abuse inflicted on the American Pit Bull Terrier and to restore the excellent reputation once held by them during the 20th century, through education, rescue, rehabilitation, and adoption( credit: www.jasmineshouse.org). Jasmine's House urgently needs your help with Geneva, a 13 year old female pit bull rescued during a large drug raid in Baltimore City. Geneva was

the Internet giant. SCHMIDT SELLS SHARES In a regulatory filing last week, Google Inc. said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google Inc. stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of December 31, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares of Google Inc. stock and controlled 9.6 percent of the company's voting power. Eric Schmidt plans to sell about 534,000 shares of Class

I'm not sure as to who the panel are going to be. was appointed by Bill Clinton as commerce secretary, none other than Donald Rumsfeld spoke favorably at his confirmation hearing. Daley was mildly but publicly critical of Barack Obama 's health-care reform strategy. He argued last year: We've really got to listen carefully to the public. Voters are not re-embracing conservative ideology. But we must acknowledge that the left's agenda has not won the support of a majority of Americans- and, based on that recognition, we must steer a more moderate course. Barack Obama has put into place a staff structure that would allow for a shift toward the center-left. The hard left thinks this happened years ago- but it is only true when measured against its own uncompromising ideals

: America's Pursuit of Power in the Middle East" last year, writes in the online analysis in great detail about various aspects of the war with a special emphasis on the war's ending. A year after the war, Saddam Hussein mocked President Bush from Baghdad and claimed victory: "It was George H.W. Bush with his own will who decided to stop the fighting. Nobody had asked him to do so.' Seizing on that appearance of presidential weakness, Bill Clinton campaigned that year against President Bush - and beat him- chiding George H.W. Bush for not putting Saddam Hussein and his acolytes on trial for war crimes. " Bill Clinton would prove no more effective than George H.W. Bush in removing Saddam Hussein , Geoffrey Wawro noted. "Perhaps Colin Powell said it best, in his post-war memoirs, when he compared the pressures weighing on George H.W. about former colleagues, such as Condoleezza Rice , whom he criticises for avoiding tough choices as head of the National Security Council, Donald Rumsfeld 's instinct seems to be to back off. He tells me that Condoleezza Rice is a smart and able woman, let there be no doubt. A very accomplished person and a good person. Some antagonisms, however, are too open to disguise. To Donald Rumsfeld there is no connection between that preoccupation and the subsequent falsehood of the principal justification for the war with Saddam Hussein : the existence of weapons of mass destruction. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie. George Tenet did not lie. Rice[ Condoleeza] did not lie. I did not lie. The Congress did not lie. The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong, he writes. And, needless to say, the various intelligence agencies were responsible for them getting it wrong.
